summary.p: Thanks [for sending a book]. The Basel [theologians] are upset with the Bernese because they distance themselves from Bucer due to his "retractions"; requests information through Luzius Tscharner about the stance of the Zurichers on Bucer's letter [No. 939]. Greetings. A daughter of David Gladiator has just delivered a letter from Bullinger [to the Bernese pastors]; a response will follow later. With his "retractions," Bucer wants to push [the Swiss] towards a similar [reassessment of the doctrine of the Lord's Supper].

div.p: At the very hour when our assistant teacher was already prepared to set out towards Zurich, what you sent was delivered to me most gratefully. For all of which, I give thanks, not as much as I owe, but as much as I can.

There is nothing new, except that we hear bad things from the Basel theologians, I don't know for what reasons related to Bucer's Retractions; for it seems they threaten us with having no further dealings with the man. I earnestly request that you inform us through Luzius Tscharner what you in Zurich will respond to the common letter of Bucer.
Meanwhile, fare well, and give my regards to Theodor, Bellicanus, Pindarus, Steiner, Beatus, and all the other brothers.

As I seal this letter, my dear Bullinger, the daughter of David Gladiator has come, from whom I receive the letters you sent to us. It is not possible for me to respond to them at present. We will respond to everything later.
In summary: Bucer does not retract with any other intention than to make us all do the same, whether we want to or not.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger of Zurich, his singular friend.
